title: Ticket #6886: Improve multifile curl plugin to allow uploads
description:
The multifile curl plugin does not currently support uploads, but this is needed to make the work in #6885 usable.

In terms of interfaces, I believe this can be done with two changes:

  1. The plugin should take an additional argument -upload; in that case, instead of downloading the provided URL to a local filename, it uploads the URL from the local file.
  2. In the ClassAd from the starter, we should rename the attribute DownloadFileName to LocalFileName to reflect the fact it doesn't actually download in this case.

For the code itself - we likely need to refactor / clean up so we can separate out common libcurl setup / teardown from the download-specific pieces. This would allow us to share code between the upload and the download logic.
remarks:
2019-Feb-09 08:54:37 by bbockelm:
Per discussion with ToddT, went ahead and merged this.

There are no user-visible changes right now as there is no way to get HTCondor to invoke the multifile curl plugin.

However, we hopefully soon will enable the multifile upload code. If that code makes it for 8.9.1, then this is likely worth a mention.

  • OpenLocalFile() should use safe_fopen_wrapper() instead of regular fopen().

  • Why are we still supporting the dav:// an davs:// protocols? I thought these were only for testing and not needed anymore?
